bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Talcott Williams, 12 October 1884
bibl.orgName: Columbia University Libraries, Rare Book & Manuscript Library, New York

revisionDesc.change: transcribed, encoded and annotated from Miller.

body.p: After I sent your note in answer yesterday—& reading yours again—I have perpetrated this—do I understand you are to have a long varied Blaine melange like in sections—the Presidential canvas business, of course? If so you might find a spot in the course of it all, where this screed may come in—
—If that don't suit you, or is not practicable (though I hope it will be, as I should like it just as well) print it by itself, like the little piece of Friday last.
—I will call about 10. this evening to see proof.
